Taiwan companies keen on FTA with India: Trade Official
items.author: Subhayan Chakraborty, ETtech
items.summary:
- Taiwanese firms are urging an *FTA* with India to deepen business ties as bilateral trade has doubled to **$11.78 billion** in 2024–25.
- The *semiconductor* sector is central, with projects like **Tata–PSMC**'s ₹91,000 crore wafer fab and **Foxconn**'s OSAT JV in Jewar driving investment.
- Next steps emphasize expanding *talent exchanges* and B2B cooperation, with MediaTek and other Taiwanese firms hiring Indian IC designers to build the ecosystem.

items.title: Forging India’s 4IR manufacturers
US plans 1:1 chip production rule to curb overseas reliance
items.summary:
- The US is proposing a *1:1 domestic-to-import* rule for semiconductors, forcing chipmakers to match overseas imports with US production or face **tariffs**.
- Firms would receive credit for pledged US manufacturing with temporary import relief while plants ramp up to *reshore* supply chains for *economic security*.
- The proposal has driven investment and lifted stocks like *GlobalFoundries*, but remains unconfirmed by the White House and Commerce Department.

items.title: TSMC denies investment or partnership talks with Intel
items.summary:
- TSMC denied reports it held talks about *investments* or *partnerships*, rejecting a Wall Street Journal claim that *Intel* sought investment or collaboration.
- The company said it never discussed joint ventures, licensing, or *technology transfers*, while its *ADRs* dipped ~1.44% amid client-trust concerns.
- Intel has raised funds from the US government, SoftBank and *Nvidia* as it restructures, but TSMC says no collaboration is underway.

items.title: Trump announces 100 per cent Tariff on imported pharmaceuticals without US-based manufacturing plants
Supreme Court allows green cracker manufacture in Delhi-NCR
items.summary:
- The Supreme Court permitted *manufacturing* of NEERI- and PESO-certified *green crackers* in Delhi-NCR, on the condition of an undertaking that there will be **no sales in the NCR** until further orders.
- The bench directed the Centre to consult stakeholders including the *Delhi government*, manufacturers and sellers to propose revisions to the manufacturing ban, saying a complete ban has been hard to enforce.
- The case was posted for hearing on Oct 8 amid warnings that allowing manufacture could lead to illicit sales, with the court favouring a *balanced approach* over extreme orders.

items.title: Iran, Russia sign $25 billion deal to build four nuclear power plants
items.summary:
- Iran signed a **$25 billion** deal with **Russia's Rosatom** to build four Generation III nuclear plants in Sirik, Hormozgan on 500 hectares, expected to produce *5,000 MW*. 
- The MOU, signed in Moscow, follows the Russia-built Bushehr plant (≈1 GW) and aims to ease Iran's power shortages while expanding civilian nuclear capacity. 
- The agreement deepens Iran–Russia ties and raises regional geopolitical concerns amid Israeli claims about Iran's nuclear intentions (which Tehran denies).

items.title: Tata Consumer Products, Godrej Agrovet sign ₹2,960 cr investment pact with food ministry
Carbon-free data centres to drive jobs, green energy
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Union Minister Shripad Yesso Naik said *carbon-free* data centres will create *green jobs* and spur indigenous manufacturing of **renewable energy** and *storage systems*.
- The First Data Centre Summit on Carbon-Free energy, organised by *NSEFI* in partnership with Amazon, urged convergence of digital and clean energy and new digital-energy business models.
- NSEFI highlighted that centres can meet needs via solar, wind and storage, including decentralised agrivoltaic sourcing from farmers' fields.

items.title: Enlight Metals eyes ₹1,200 crore sales with expansion and new service centers
Oakter launches Studio AC 5000 at ₹15,500
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Oakter launched the Studio AC 5000 at *₹15,500*, a compact, *plug-and-play* 0.5-ton (1550W) AC aimed at rooms up to *75 sq ft* and sold on Amazon and Flipkart.
- The unit draws up to *450 W/h* on a 230V/6A socket, weighs 18.5 kg, measures 35×41×30 cm, and operates at about 57.6 dB for DIY installation without technicians.
- It features a *condensation reuse* system to recycle condensate, reduce dripping in humid conditions, and position itself between heavy-duty ACs and basic coolers for energy-efficient portability.

items.title: India retires MiG-21 after 63 years
items.summary: - The *MiG-21* fleet flew for the last time in a decommissioning ceremony at Chandigarh Air Base attended by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and top military chiefs. - Inducted in 1963, the jet was a cornerstone of the *Indian Air Force*, seeing action in 1971, Kargil, and engagements up to 2019 while training generations of pilots. - Its retirement ends a 63‑year era, signaling a shift to newer fighters while preserving the *MiG-21*'s enduring legacy in India's defence.

Shree Refrigerations secures defence contracts from Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders
items.summary:
*Shree Refrigerations* won a ₹49.34 crore contract to supply HVAC systems and magnetic bearing compressors to *Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders*.
- This follows a previous order of ₹106.62 crore from *Hindustan Shipyard* and ongoing work with *Goa Shipyard Ltd*.
- The company's shares rose 7%, reflecting investor confidence in its defense and industrial project growth.

**Keywords:** defense contracts, HVAC, refrigeration, shipbuilding, India

items.title: India Signs ₹62,370 Crore Deal for 97 LCA Mk1A Jets
items.summary:
*India's Defence Ministry signed a ₹62,370 crore contract with HAL for 97 LCA Mk1A jets, including 68 fighter and 29 twin-seater variants.*
- The aircraft will feature over 64% indigenous content and advanced onboard systems, with deliveries starting in 2027-28.
- The Mk1A is intended to replace the aging MiG-21 fighters, addressing the IAF's fighter squadron shortages.*

items.title: India considers French fighter jet engines amid US delays
items.summary:
*India is exploring French-made fighter jet engines as US joint manufacturing talks slow down.* 
*India aims to build nearly 200 advanced jets to replace aging aircraft and boost domestic defense production.*
*Tensions in India-US relations have affected defense collaborations, prompting India to diversify its sources.*
